## Complex

This is an implementation of [complex data
type][125] as a JavaScript class,
only written in TypeScript for static typing.  It is for educational purposes
on how to implement an [abstract data
type][126] or what [complex
numbers][127] are, and is not
intended for practical use.

Complex numbers have two representations: rectangular and polar forms.  We
use the former internally to keep the real and imaginary parts in JavaScript
numbers (i.e., 64-bit floating-point numbers).

### add

Addition.
(a + bi) + (c + di) = (a + c) + (b + d)i.

#### Parameters

*   `other` &#x20;

### sub

Subtraction.
(a + bi) - (c + di) = (a - c) + (b - d)i.

#### Parameters

*   `other` &#x20;

### mul

Multiplication.
(a + bi)(c + di) = (ac - bd) + (ad + bc)i.

#### Parameters

*   `other` &#x20;

### div

Division.
(a + bi)/(c + di) = \[(ac + bd) + (bc - ad)i]/(c^2 + d^2).

#### Parameters

*   `other` &#x20;

### neg

Additive inverse.
-(a + bi) = -a - bi.

### conj

Complex conjugate.
(a + bi)\* = a - bi.

### equals

Equality.
a + bi = c + di iff a = c and b = d.

#### Parameters

*   `other` &#x20;

### toString

String representation in rectangular form.

### fromPolar

Creates a complex number in polar form.

#### Parameters

*   `abs` &#x20;
*   `arg` &#x20;

### abs

Absolute value.
|a + bi| = sqrt(a^2 + b^2).

#### Parameters

*   `z` &#x20;

### arg

Argument.
arg(a + bi) = atan2(b, a).

#### Parameters

*   `z` &#x20;

### sqrt

Square root.
sqrt(re^it) = sqrt(r) e^(it/2).

#### Parameters

*   `z` &#x20;

### exp

Exponential function.
exp(a + bi) = exp(a) e^ib.

#### Parameters

*   `z` &#x20;

### log

Logarithm.
ln(re^it) = ln(r) + it.

#### Parameters

*   `z` &#x20;

### pow

Exponentiation.
z^w = e^\[w ln(z)].

#### Parameters

*   `z` &#x20;
*   `w` &#x20;

### sin

Sine.
sin(a + bi) = sin(a) cosh(b) + i cos(a) sinh(b).

#### Parameters

*   `z` &#x20;

### cos

Cosine.
cos(a + bi) = cos(a) cosh(b) - i sin(a) sinh(b).

#### Parameters

*   `z` &#x20;

### tan

Tangent.
tan(a + bi) = \[sin(2a) + i sinh(2b)]/\[cos(2a) + cosh(2b)].

#### Parameters

*   `z` &#x20;

### asin

Inverse sine.
arcsin(z) = -i ln\[sqrt(1 - z^2) + iz].

#### Parameters

*   `z` &#x20;

### acos

Inverse cosine.
arccos(z) = -i ln\[i sqrt(1 - z^2) + z].

#### Parameters

*   `z` &#x20;

### atan

Inverse tangent.
arctan(z) = -i/2 ln\[(i - z)/(i + z)].

#### Parameters

*   `z` &#x20;

### I

The imaginary unit.

## Complex

### add

Addition.
(a + bi) + (c + di) = (a + c) + (b + d)i.

#### Parameters

*   `other` &#x20;

*   `other` &#x20;

## Complex

Creates a complex number in rectangular form.

### Parameters

*   `real` &#x20;
*   `imag` &#x20;

### add

Addition.
(a + bi) + (c + di) = (a + c) + (b + d)i.

#### Parameters

*   `other` &#x20;

### sub

Subtraction.
(a + bi) - (c + di) = (a - c) + (b - d)i.

#### Parameters

*   `other` &#x20;

### mul

Multiplication.
(a + bi)(c + di) = (ac - bd) + (ad + bc)i.

#### Parameters

*   `other` &#x20;

### div

Division.
(a + bi)/(c + di) = \[(ac + bd) + (bc - ad)i]/(c^2 + d^2).

#### Parameters

*   `other` &#x20;

### neg

-(a + bi) = -a - bi.

### conj

Complex conjugate.
(a + bi)\* = a - bi.

### equals

Equality.
a + bi = c + di iff a = c and b = d.

#### Parameters

*   `other` &#x20;

### toString

String representation in rectangular form.

### fromPolar

Creates a complex number in polar form.

#### Parameters

*   `abs` &#x20;
*   `arg` &#x20;
